title: Ankylosing Spondylitis Management
content: Ankylosing spondylitis is a chronic inflammatory disease primarily affecting the spine and sacroiliac joints. Management focuses on physical therapy to maintain posture and spinal mobility, combined with NSAIDs for pain and inflammation. Biologic medications targeting TNF-alpha or IL-17 are effective for severe or progressive disease. Regular monitoring for extra-articular manifestations such as uveitis is essential.
